worms.model

Class Worm

  • java.lang.Object
    • worms.model.Worm

  • public class Worm
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that represents a worm with a given position, direction, radius, mass and name. A worm's name may change during the game. Each worm has a certain density, a maximum (and current) number of action points.
    Version:
    1.0 https://github.com/hazzarux/worms.git
    Author:
    Yanice SLEGERS (1ste bachelor informatica, r0456491), Fevzi Yigit OZKAN (1ste bachelor informatica, r0456142)

@Immutable
public static double getMinimalRadius()

        Returns:
        The minimal radius of the worm's body. | result == 0.25

      • getRegex

        public static java.lang.String getRegex()
        Return the regular expression needed to validate the name of this worm. The first letter should be an uppercase letter. The name must be at least 2 characters long. Names can use letters, quotes (both single and double) and spaces.
        Returns:
        The regular expression needed to validate the name | result == "[A-Z]([a-zA-Z'\" ]+)"

        @Basic
@Raw
public double getX()
        Return the x-coordinate of this worm in meters. The x-coordinate expresses the distance in meters between the origin and this worm on the x-axis.
        Returns:
        x The x-coordinate of this worm.

      • canHaveAsRadius

        @Raw
public boolean canHaveAsRadius(double radius)
        Check whether the radius is valid for this worm.
        Parameters:
        radius - The radius to check
        Returns:
        True if and only if the radius is greater than or equal to the minimal radius of a worm. | radius >= getMinimalRadius()

      • canHaveAsOrientation

        @Raw
public boolean canHaveAsOrientation(double orientation)
        Check whether the orientation of this worm is valid.
        Parameters:
        orientation - The orientation to check.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the orientation is between 0 and 2*pi. | (fuzzyLessThanOrEqualTo(orientation, pi)) && (fuzzyGreaterThanOrEqualTo(orientation, -pi)))

      • canHaveAsName

        @Raw
public boolean canHaveAsName(java.lang.String name)
        Check if the given name of this worm is a correct name.
        Parameters:
        name - The new name of this worm.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the name of this worm can be validated by the regular expression returned by getRegex(). | result == name.matches(getRegex())

      • canHaveAsNumberOfSteps

        @Raw
public boolean canHaveAsNumberOfSteps(int numberOfSteps)
        Check if the number of steps is a valid number of steps for this worm.
        Parameters:
        numberOfSteps - The number of steps of this worm.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given number of steps of this worm is a non-negative number. | numberOfSteps >= 0

      • hasEnoughActionPoints

        @Raw
public boolean hasEnoughActionPoints(int actionPointsToCheck)
        Check that there are still enough action points for the next move of this worm.
        Parameters:
        actionPointsToCheck - The action points that are needed for the next move of this worm.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the actionPointsToCheck are smaller or equal to the current action points. | actionPointToCheck <= getActionPoints()

      • canTurn

        @Raw
public boolean canTurn(double angle)
        Check if this worm still is able to turn.
        Parameters:
        angle - The number of radians the orientation of this worm increases/decreases.
        Returns:
        True if and only if there are still enough action points, the angle is valid and if there are still action points left for this worm. | isValidOrientation(angle) && hasActionPoints() && hasEnoughActionPoints(calculateActionPoints(angle))

      • wormIsFacingDownwards

        public boolean wormIsFacingDownwards()
        Check if this worm is facing downwards.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the orientation of this worm is between pi and 2*pi. | (getOrientation() < (2*pi)) && (getOrientation() > pi)

      • canMove

        public boolean canMove(int numberOfSteps)
        Check if the worm can move.
        Parameters:
        numberOfSteps - The number of steps this worms wants to take.
        Returns:
        True if and only if there are still enough action points for moving this worm. | hasEnoughActionPoints(nuberOfSteps*calculateCost())

      • calculateMass

        public double calculateMass(double density,
                   double radius)
                     throws ModelException
        Calculate the mass of this worm, derived from the density and the radius.
        Parameters:
        density - The homogeneous density of this worm.
        radius - The radius of this worm.
        Returns:
        mass The calculated mass of this worm. | mass = density*((4/3)*Math.PI*Math.pow(radius, 3))
        Throws:
        java.lang.StackOverflowError - This function is not allowed to use too much memory on the call stack.
        java.lang.OutOfMemoryError - There is not enough memory for this function to be executed.
        ModelException - Throws a ModelException when there is an error calculating the mass.

      • turn

        public void turn(double angle)
        Changes the orientation of this worm.
        Parameters:
        angle - The number of radians the orientation increases/decreases.

      • move

        public void move(int numberOfSteps)
        Let this worm execute a move.
        Parameters:
        numberOfSteps - The number of steps this worm makes.
        Throws:
        ModelException - This worm's number of steps should never be less than zero. | ! canHaveAsNumberOfSteps(numberOfSteps)
        ModelException - This worm should have enough action points to move. | ! canMove(numberOfSteps)

      • jump

        public void jump()
        Let this worm execute a jump.
        Throws:
        ModelException - This worm should have at least 1 action point to jump. | ! hasActionPoints()
        ModelException - This worm should be facing upwards to jump. | ! wormIsFacingDownwards()

      • jumpStep

        public double[] jumpStep(double deltaT)
        Return an array containing in-flight positions of this jumping worm at any deltaT seconds after launch.
        Parameters:
        deltaT - The seconds after launch.
        Returns:
        array Array containing in-flight position x_deltaT and y_deltaT | array[0] = xDeltaT | array[1] = yDeltaT
        Throws:
        ModelException - This worm should have at least 1 action point for jumpStep to be able to run. | ! hasActionPoints()

      • jumpTime

        public double jumpTime()
        Return the time for a potential jump for this worm.
        Returns:
        The potential time for a potential jump for this worm. | jumpTime = calculateJumpTime(jumpDistance, initialVelocity)
